page.title: 03HOUSES
page.content: There is a wide variety of houses in the area.Some houses are made of local clunch stone.Others are brick,half_ timbered, wattle and daub and plastered. Commercial End and the High street in Swaffham Bulbeck are conservation areas.The Abbey is probably the oldest house in Swaffham Bulbeck.It was built 900 years ago.Burgh Hall,Mitchell Hall,Malt House,Lordship Farm and the Vicarage are the biggest houses in Swaffham Bulbeck. Fewer houses in Swaffham Bulbeck are owner occupied than is usual in the area or in the country as a whole. This is because of a large council estate and a lot of council_owned old peoples dwellings.There is a similar mixture of houses in Lode and Longmeadow but there are more thatched roofs in Lode.
